author: Special Correspondent
text:
Syed Abbas Tublani, arrested for allegedly threatening and plotting to attack on a city-based journalist, was sent to Sharjah in 1999, police sources revealed on Tuesday.

Tublani was arrested on December 31 last year by the Anti Extortion Cell of the Mumbai Police Crime Branch in connection with the threats received by journalist S. Balakrishnan. Further investigations revealed that Tublani was an important figure in 1993 bomb blasts accused Dawood Ibrahim Kaskar’s gang and had even worked as a driver for Dawood’s brother Anees in Dubai for eight years before coming back to India.

“In 1998, Abu Salem, who earlier used to work for the Kaskar gang, parted ways with Dawood to set up his own gang. A year later, Tublani fled India and went to Dubai, after which he started working as a driver for Anees. Tublani’s interrogation has revealed that the same year, Anees ordered Tublani to hunt down Salem, who was in Sharjah at the time, and kill him,” said an officer.

Tublani allegedly said in his interrogation that he went to Sharjah and started his inquiries to find out Salem’s whereabouts on Anees’ instructions. However, he only got as far as finding Fazl-ur Rehman, an aide of Salem, who was also based in Sharjah.

“Tublani tracked Rehman and demanded that he reveal Salem’s whereabouts, and Rehman dismissively told him to leave him alone. The confrontation turned violent but Rehman did not yield to Tublani,” the officer added.

Tublani also worked as a driver to Dawood’s brother Anees in Dubai for eight years
title: Shakeel aide was sent to kill Salem in Sharjah: police
